column4: I've upgraded to ubuntu and I'm running an nvidia card, when i try to startx I get an error that says caught singal 11. The log does not have any extra information. Any ideas?
what kernel?
adjacent 2.6.12-9
nope.
apt-get install linux-modules-restricted-2.6.12-9
then go into xorg.conf and change /usr/lib/X11/fonts/blah to /usr/share/X11/fonts/blah
and you may need to change your keyboard driver name from keyboard to kbd
i assume you are in the same position i was earlier. using nvidia driver, dist-upgrade to breezy, and xorg wont start up
adjacent thats right
thanks
if you check those things i told you it should come up nicely
and you may want to change firefox fonts to bitstream fonts because they look nasty otherwise
adjacent none of that worked. Whats wierd is I can use the vesa or nv driver. But not the nvidia driver
do you have the 2.6.12-9 restricted modules?
adjacent yes, I have the proper restriced modules
if there is nothing in /var/log/Xorg.0.log im stumped too. sorry
adjacent when i attempt to startx I see an nvidia logo, but the X log says something like. "agpgart: Putting AGP V3 device at 0000:01:00.0 into 4x mode"
adjacent thats the last line.
adjacent I'd like to jsut reinstall the whole dang thing. But for some reason cdrecord wont work either
looks like a bug. possibly downgrade udev
adjacent in cdrecord?
im not sure. but it sounds like hotplug or udev is having a problem....
adjacent Then I'll boot into knoppix, burn the cd and reinstall this bad boy. I suspect m cutomization have cased problems
good luck
